intro: Dresslerella stellaris, commonly known as the starry dresslerella, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. The plant belongs to the family Campanulaceae, which includes bellflowers and similar species. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Dresslerella stellaris thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments.
